snippet: Employees more critical of the company say it has found subtle ways to hinder workers’ compensation, such as a training program that can keep pay at $9 an hour.
abstract: Some Walmart employees criticize company's new pay policies, which pledge to raise wages to at least $10 an hour for part- and full-time workers; advocates say company has found ways to subtle ways to hinder workers' compensation, including cutting merit raises and implementing training program that can keep employees at $9 an hour for as long as 18 months.
lead_paragraph: Employees more critical of the company say it has found subtle ways to hinder workers’ compensation, such as a training program that can keep pay at $9 an hour.

headline.main: Walmart Worker Advocates Express Skepticism Over Raises
headline.print_headline: Some Walmart Workers  Criticize New Pay Policy
